TrustedScriptURL.summary: The TrustedScriptURL interface of the {{domxref("Trusted Types API", "", "", "nocode")}} represents a string that a developer can insert into an injection sink that will parse it as a URL of an external script. These objects are created via and therefore have no constructor.

remarks.para: The value of a TrustedScriptURL object is set when the object is created and cannot be changed by JavaScript as there is no setter exposed.
-Prevent DOM-based cross-site scripting vulnerabilities with Trusted Types

TrustedScriptURLToString.summary: The toString() method of the interface returns a string which may safely inserted into an injection sink.
TrustedScriptURLToString.returns: A string containing the sanitized URL

TrustedScriptURLToJSON.summary: The toJSON() method of the interface returns a JSON representation of the stored data.
TrustedScriptURLToJSON.returns: A string containing a JSON representation of the stored data.
